title: gendergp.com/new-study-confirm...

last_post.content:
This is BIG. A new study in the Journal of the American Society of Plastic Surgeons, has highlighted a regret rate of only 0.3% for gender-affirming surgeries.

To put that into context, the regret rate for knee replacements is around 20% and plastic surgery can be up to 65%. Gender-affirming surgery... 0.3% 🤷

Yet MORE scientific research debunking the misinformation that's spread about the trans and gender diverse community 🎉 Read more on this research below ❤️

https://www.gendergp.com/new-study-confirms-regret-rates-of-gender-affirming-surgery-are-non-existent/?ma=1

title: Is the Alpha Wolf Idea a Myth?

last_post.content:
Turns out the existence of an "alpha" wolf is a myth.

It was based on old/bad experiments, conducted when unrelated wolves were thrown together in captivity.

In actual wild wolves, packs are just families. There's no dominant alpha battling for the top spot -- and in the rare cases there is, it's an alpha *female* wolf.

Insert obvious implications for the use of this term in human societies.

https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/is-the-alpha-wolf-idea-a-myth/

"In this work, we introduce Kosmos-1, a Multimodal Large Language Model (MLLM) [...] results show that Kosmos-1 achieves impressive performance on (i) language understanding, generation, and even OCR-free NLP (directly fed with document images), (ii) perception-language tasks, including multimodal dialogue, image captioning, visual question answering, and (iii) vision tasks, such as image recognition with descriptions (specifying classification via text instructions)"¹

title: Seeing triple

last_post.content:
JWST Sees the Same Supernova Three Times in an Epic Gravitational Lens

Thanks to a powerful gravitational lens, astronomers were fortunate enough to see the same supernova three times in a distant galaxy. The lens is the galaxy cluster RX J2129, located about 3.2 billion light-years from Earth. When examining the region, researchers noticed that one of the lensed galaxies is duplicated three times - and they all contain the same supernova. Because the light took different paths, the same supernova is seen hundreds of days apart, showing its evolution in a single image.

https://www.esa.int/ESA_Multimedia/Images/2023/02/Seeing_triple

title: Mastodon Users (@mastodonusercount@mastodon.social)

last_post.content:
Proof that Twitter outages are correlated to Mastodon sign-ups.

Today, when Twitter had a global outage, sign-ups to Mastodon peaked at 762 sign-ups an hour.

This is 262 more than the ~500/hour this past week has averaged—a 52% increase.

I've noticed this pattern multiple times.

Every time Twitter goes down, sign-ups to Mastodon increase.

https://mastodon.social/@mastodonusercount/109948149590452209

@fediversenews

title: Faculty Promotions and Tenure Announced - Newsroom | University of St. Thomas

last_post.content: Not sure when people usually share this kind of news, but the university announcement is public, so.... I got tenure and promotion to associate professor!! It takes effect September 1. Can't believe I will soon not be "junior faculty" anymore. https://news.stthomas.edu/faculty-promotions-and-tenure-announced-4/

title: Release Whisper and GCP Compute Runners · CouncilDataProject/cookiecutter-cdp-deployment

last_post.content:
@MattHodges we just released v4 of Council Data Project which uses Whisper for transcripts too!

https://github.com/CouncilDataProject/cookiecutter-cdp-deployment/releases/tag/v4.0.0

It uses GitHub actions to spin up a GCP compute engine instance, processes the events, and then tears down the instance. GitHub Actions keeps the logs and makes it easier for users to trigger their own runs as well as CRON.

It's incredibly incredibly cheap.

title: How Journalists Can Responsibly Report on Trans Kids

last_post.content:
"The 'debate' over #trans kids is happening now not because of any new scientific data showing cracks in the regularly prescribed regimen given to trans adolescents. It’s the result of a growing movement of anti-trans activists and conservative politicians who want to limit #LGBTQ rights, especially after losing on gay marriage and failing to make headway in passing anti-trans bathroom bills."

https://nbcuacademy.com/trans-kids-journalism/

title: Use your reference interview skills to do user research - Choice 360

last_post.content:
I wrote about how the reference interview is similar to doing user research: https://www.choice360.org/libtech-insight/use-your-reference-interview-skills-to-do-user-research/

The skills of an adept reference librarian include building rapport with the patron, posing productive questions, and avoiding being judgmental. These skills are transferable to doing user research!

#libraries

title: Generative AI is sowing the seeds of doubt in serious science

last_post.content:
“Chatbots can spew an on-demand stream of citation-heavy pseudoscience on why vaccination doesn’t work, or why global warming is a hoax. That misleading material, posted online, can then be swallowed by future generative AI to produce a new iteration of falsehoods that further pollutes public discourse.”
https://www.ft.com/content/e34c24f6-1159-4b88-8d92-a4bda685a73c

title: Freedom of the Press Foundation's Digital Security Digest newsletter subscription page

last_post.content: For @freedomofpress I'm kicking off a weekly newsletter on digital security and journalism. It'll be a short update on security news, what you can do about it, and updates from our team. Subscribe here to get those emails as soon as we're live: https://freedom.press/training/digisec-subscribe/

title: pacscenter.stanford.edu/event/...

last_post.content:
Independent research on technology and society is a critical public good with real power, which is why it needs defending.

Today at Stanford, I'lll be joining Kaveh Waddell (Consumer Reports), Touissaint Nothias (Stanford), and Elizabeth Eagen (CAT Lab) to discuss the Coalition for Independent Technology Research.

The talk, at 1:30pm PT, will be accessible online. Thanks for hosting us @p2173!

https://pacscenter.stanford.edu/event/meet-the-coalition-for-independent-tech-research/

title: Comics Workshop for Teachers

last_post.content: I did a comics-making workshop for teachers this week, and ended up documenting much of what we did. I detailed all the activities on my site with instructions, images, examples, PDF breakdowns of how I approach things, along with all the books I drew from. Have a look & share on! https://spinweaveandcut.com/comics-workshop-for-teachers/

title: Texas Republican wants ISPs to block a wide range of abortion websites

last_post.content:
It was only a matter of time: a Texas lawmaker has proposed a bill that would force ISPs like Comcast and AT&T to completely block websites containing information about how to obtain an abortion.

This is why we need #netneutrality & a functioning FCC. https://arstechnica.com/tech-policy/2023/03/texas-republican-wants-isps-to-block-a-wide-range-of-abortion-websites/

title: https://www.dabeaz.com/raft.html

last_post.content:
I'll be honest--I don't miss the birdsite. However, I can't deny the possible effect of its implosion on getting the word out about my classes.

If you want a serious CS project course that will test your coding and design mettle, my upcoming Rafting Trip course (March 27-31) might do the trick. https://www.dabeaz.com/raft.html.
